intro: Artedia muricata, commonly known as the spiked artedia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its striking, spiky leaves and clusters of small, colorful flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Artedia muricata typically thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
